result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Madsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph M Madsen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph M Madsen was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $300.00 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office- to be paid on a monthly payment plan of $100.00 beginning on 6-1-16 and on the first of each month until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC. This cost is added to the monthly payment plan, which is set at $100.00 per month. Failure to pay will be warrant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Madsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M Madsen in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 11:07AM 11:09 off record. 11:16 back on record. CT reviews Pro Se PLQ. CT finds comp to rep self. Plea of G to Ct 1. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC. Dismiss Ct 2. 

SENTENCE: $500 fine includes DNA surcharge. PP of $100/mo. beg 6-1-16 and 1st of e/m thereafter. 11:22am adj.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.

Defendant Joseph M Madsen in court, with Atty Brian Smestad as friend of court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB- Clerk 308pm Does not qualify, would like to represent self. CT questions; finds Compet. to rep self. WST. NG pleas. bond cont. 316pm adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
